image.altText: A man in a prison uniform looks at the camera with a serious expression on his face.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin says Russia has "no need" to recruit foreign fighters to bolster its invasion of Ukraine, but inside this prisoner of war camp, people have a very different story.

title.children: 'I was tricked': Athlete lured to Russia for work ends up on front lines

image.altText: Blurry vision of an oil tanker with 'Unclassified' written in green letters at the top.

props.synopsis: Tensions between the US and Venezuela are soaring after American forces seized an oil tanker in the Caribbean Sea. So why is US President Donald Trump targeting so-called "shadow fleets"?

title.children: This ship spent months in 'shadow', then US forces swooped in

image.altText: A young blonde woman smiles as she sits in a restaurant.

props.synopsis: The search volunteer who found the phone said he "just melted" when he saw the phone, which has been confirmed as belonging to Celine Cremer, who went missing two and a half years ago.

title.children: Mobile phone found in renewed search for missing Belgian tourist

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu stands up in a courtroom, surrounded by roughly two dozen people taking pictures and looking on eagerly,

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's backers view his corruption trial as a witch hunt — but his detractors argue it is the system finally catching up to a ruthless political operative who is prepared to do anything to hold on to power.

title.children: Netanyahu's corruption trial has became a struggle for Israel itself

image.altText: a nsw police officer holds a speed camera beside a road

props.synopsis: Since the trial to return demerit points began almost two years ago, more than 1.7 million licence holders have benefited from their safe driving.

title.children: Safe driving to be permanently rewarded in NSW

image.altText: The symbol of the United Nations on a building

props.synopsis: A delegation of United Nations inspectors have raised the alarm about Australia's detention facilities and a breach of human rights.

title.children: United Nations inspectors warn Australia is breaching human rights

image.altText: Maria Corina Machado speaking into a black microphone while holding up a white election paper

props.synopsis: Maria Corina Machado hid in fear for her life under Venezuela's Maduro regime. This is how her fight to restore democracy started more than 20 years ago.

title.children: The US-supported 'Iron Lady' who came out of hiding to claim the Nobel Peace Prize

image.altText: Two beds with floral sheets.

props.synopsis: These photographs might look like everyday objects, but the AFP-led Australian Centre to Counter Child Exploitation (ACCCE) believe they could help identify victims of online child sexual exploitation.

title.children: Federal police release nine images to help identify child sex abuse victims

image.altText: A sprint car lost its tyre during a race at Avalon Raceway on Friday.

props.synopsis: Race spectators were metres away from a flying wheel that tore through a fence after detaching from a sprint car at the Fireball Derby last night near Geelong.

title.children: Children 'traumatised' as wheel flies off speedway car into crowd at racetrack

image.altText: A younger Donald Trump is pictured with Jeffrey Epstein speaking to a woman.

props.synopsis: Democrats publish more photos from Jeffrey Epstein's estate as part of their pressure campaign for the full and immediate release of the Epstein files.

title.children: 'White House cover-up needs to end': Democrats release more Epstein photos, including some featuring Trump

image.altText: A group of cricketers in purple huddle and celebrate on the field

props.synopsis: Hurricanes opener Lizelle Lee hits an unbeaten 77 as her side claims a first WBBL title with a dominant eight-wicket win over the Scorchers.

title.children: Lee stars as Hurricanes cruise to maiden WBBL title

image.altText: An illustration of a woman holding her stomach and cover her mouth due to sickness

props.synopsis: Every year about 1.5 million Australians travel to Bali. Chances are either you or someone you know has caught a stomach bug after travelling to the popular Indonesian destination. So what can you do to avoid it?

title.children: Experts reveal what's really behind Bali belly that ruins many holidays

image.altText: An older, skinny white man with a moustache is surrounded by white cell bars.

props.synopsis: Belarusian authorities release 123 prisoners including Nobel Peace Prize laureate Ales Bialiatski and key opposition figure Maria Kolesnikova, after talks with an envoy for US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Belarus releases Nobel winner Bialiatski as US lifts more sanctions

image.altText: Jared Kushner looks on during a swearing-in ceremony.

props.synopsis: The dramatic escalation in the fight for Warner Bros is one of the biggest in recent corporate memory, drawing an unlikely cast of celebrities and business figures including Jared Kushner.

title.children: Netflix was set to buy Warner Bros Discovery, then came the torpedo

image.altText: A green boat is hit with a water cannon being shot by a larger white boat in open sea

props.synopsis: Manila's coastguard says nearly two dozen Philippine fishing boats near Sabina Shoal were targeted with water cannon and blocking manoeuvres on Friday.

title.children: Philippine fishing vessels damaged by Chinese coast guard in South China Sea

props.synopsis: Every question has only two options: one is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

title.children: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge on The Simpsons, Gremlins and fruit

image.altText: A close up of a white man, blue button up shirt, gray tie, brown hair at collar length, looking down.

props.synopsis: Crocodile wrangler Matt Wright built a television and tourism empire in the Northern Territory, but that's all come crashing down.

title.children: Crocodile wrangler Matt Wright's prison sentence comes with a warning

image.altText: Two smiling men and a woman kneel behind a small piece of dark rock in the outback.

props.synopsis: PhD students from Curtin University have found a 300-gram meteorite after a five-day search in remote bushland.

title.children: Students find meteorite after lengthy search in outback WA

image.altText: Two tennis players, one man with a cap on and one woman in yellow, shake hands at the end of a game.

props.synopsis: High-profile Australian tennis coach Roger Rasheed has questioned the value of the upcoming "battle of the sexes"-style exhibition match between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka.

title.children: 'It's quite insulting': Criticism for 'Battle of the Sexes' tennis clash

image.altText: Usman Khawaja pictured in Australia's Test kit

props.synopsis: Australia batter Usman Khawaja is feeling 100 per cent fit and is open to a return to the middle order for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

title.children: 'I can bat anywhere': Fit Khawaja open to middle order role

image.altText: Team USA and Team Canada fight

props.synopsis: Ice hockey players from the NHL are due to compete in the Winter Olympics tournament for the first time in 12 years at Milan-Cortina. But the league is holding its breath over a rink that is smaller than expected — and isn't even complete yet.

title.children: A 'misunderstanding' means the Olympic ice hockey rink is too small

image.altText: social media ban

props.synopsis: This is where we parents should remind ourselves of the power of the loving boundary: not to bind and constrain, but to properly demonstrate that we hold our kids and their safety in our mind.

title.children: The social media ban began and my son said something unexpected

image.altText: Indra Brown completes a trick

props.synopsis: Indra Brown has been on the radar of Australian snow sport aficionados for a number of years and, in her first ever World Cup event, she has secured a stunning bronze medal.

title.children: 15yo Aussie ski prodigy wins World Cup medal on debut

image.altText: Abalone Fishing Season

props.synopsis: Perth is in the grip of its hottest spell so far this summer, forcing the closure of a popular tourist attraction as abalone fishing season got underway.

title.children: Severe heat closes WA island as abalone fishing season begins

image.altText: Salvation Army Christmas lunch

props.synopsis: The Salvation Army has held a lunch for people doing it tough, as a survey shows one in two Australians are worried how they will afford Christmas.

title.children: A reprieve for some of the Australians worried how they'll afford Christmas

image.altText: A group of about 100 protesters pose for a group shot in a city, many holding placards and three fingers aloft.

props.synopsis: Aung San Suu Kyi's son leads a rally of supporters in Sydney as part of global demonstrations trying to increase international pressure on Myanmar's ruling military junta.

title.children: Suu Kyi supporters call for release of political prisoners at Sydney rally

image.altText: A woman dressed in a protective helmet lays under stalactites in a cave

props.synopsis: It was an adventure into the unknown. From the surface all that could be seen was a small opening. The ABC has been given exclusive access to newly-discovered caves on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

title.children: A small opening in the ground hides a remarkable newly discovered cave

image.altText: A small ambulance flashes its lights on the side of a country road.

props.synopsis: Queensland's workplace health and safety regulator will investigate the death.

title.children: Young man dies under machinery at outback Queensland worksite

image.altText: A man holds out his hand with a small lump of coal in it. He is wearing hi-vis workwear.

props.synopsis: Coal mining extensions and expansions will continue, the New South Wales premier says, despite a government-appointed agency finding further approvals were not consistent with emissions targets.

title.children: Ending coal expansion 'irresponsible' NSW premier says, but report disagrees

image.altText: Battery-subsidy-thumb

props.synopsis: Federal Energy Minister Chris Bowen announces big changes to the government's battery subsidy scheme amid claims most of its $2.3 billion budget has been spent in just six months.

title.children: Government boosts home battery spend by $5 billion

image.altText: King Charles wearing a suit looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: King Charles III has revealed his cancer treatment will be reduced in the new year, describing the milestone as a "blessing" and testament to "remarkable" medical advances.

title.children: King Charles gives cancer treatment update

image.altText: A man smiling and pointing his fingers and arms ahead of him with swirls of light around him.

props.synopsis: Founded in 1975, when homosexuality was still illegal in Western Australia, Connections nightclub has seen waves of social change and kept the party going.

title.children: Perth queer nightclub celebrates 50 years of dancing and difference

image.altText: Volunteer Malia Sykes crying at a parliamentary inquiry

props.synopsis: Witnesses have told an inquiry into modern slavery that migrant workers are being exploited in the nation's blueberry capital.

title.children: Migrant workers treated 'like pigs' amid claims of modern slavery

image.altText: Aged care

props.synopsis: The reforms have unleashed a wave of confusion and despair amongst hundreds of thousands of elderly Australians, from those wanting care to those who already have it.

title.children: 'No worse off?' Aged care reforms unleash wave of confusion and despair

image.altText: Socceroos team line up

props.synopsis: Australia are among the countries with the most ticket requests for next year's World Cup, which is bound to please Socceroos coach Tony Popovic and his team.

title.children: Socceroos fans hunt for tickets despite 'extortionate' prices
